t: Psalm 102
A Prayer of the afflicted, when he is overwhelmed, and poureth out his complaint before the Lord.
Hear*p my prayer, O Lord,*s and let my cry come unto thee.
Hide*p not thy face from me in the day when I am in trouble; incline thine ear unto me: in the day when I call answer me speedily.
For*p my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as an hearth.
My*p heart is smitten, and withered like grass; so that I forget to eat my bread.
By*p reason of the voice of my groaning my bones cleave to my skin.
I*p am like a pelican of the wilderness: I am like an owl of the desert.
I*p watch, and am as a sparrow alone upon the house top.
Mine*p enemies reproach me all the day; and they that are mad against me are sworn against me.
For*p I have eaten ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping,
Because*p of thine indignation and thy wrath: for thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.
My*p days are like a shadow that declineth; and I am withered like grass.
But*p thou, O Lord,*s shalt endure for ever; and thy remembrance unto all generations.
Thou*p shalt arise, and have mercy upon Zion: for the time to favour her, yea, the set time, is come.
For*p thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and favour the dust thereof.
So*p the heathen shall fear the name of the Lord,*s and all the kings of the earth thy glory.
When*p the Lord*s shall build up Zion, he shall appear in his glory.
He*p will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise their prayer.
This*p shall be written for the generation to come: and the people which shall be created shall praise the Lord.*s
For*p he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from heaven did the Lord*s behold the earth;
To*p hear the groaning of the prisoner; to loose those that are appointed to death;
To*p declare the name of the Lord*s in Zion, and his praise in Jerusalem;
When*p the people are gathered together, and the kingdoms, to serve the Lord.*s
He*p weakened my strength in the way; he shortened my days.
I*p said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days: thy years are throughout all generations.
Of*p old hast thou laid the foundation of the earth: and the heavens are the work of thy hands.
They*p shall perish, but thou shalt endure: yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed:
But*p thou art the same, and thy years shall have no end.
The*p children of thy servants shall continue, and their seed shall be established before thee.
